column1: It's impossible to know how many little boy butts were burgled by this bad man. Who is he?
This jazz fusion drummer has recorded and toured with BrandX, Robert Plant, Eric Clapton, Thin Lizzy, Brian Eno, Genesis, Tommy Bolin, Andrew Lloyd Webber, and others. Who is he?
Who was the first rock band to play at Budokan in Tokyo, Japan?
Which Beatle had the first number one single as a solo artist?
Keith Richards famously sneered the following about which singer: "An old bitch...his writing is limited to songs about dead blondes"?
Who starred as Pink in the 1982 film version of Pink Floyd's The Wall?
What jazz great played on the Rolling Stones' song "Waiting on a Friend"?
Rick James was in a 1960's group named The Mynah Birds that included this future staple of classic rock radio.
This guitar player loves to step all over the vocals.
What band lost two members to motorcycle accidents in the same three block area virtually a year apart?
What future outlaw country superstar gave up his seat to the Big Bopper the Day the Music Died?
At whose Lagos, Nigeria studio did Paul McCartney and Wings record most of their Band on the Run album?
Name the musicians who had parents that were Holocaust concentration camp survivors during the Second World War.
Which Pink Floyd band member left the band after the recording of the Wall and was attained as a salaried session musician during the subsequent tour?
Mardi Gras, the last album by Creedence Clearwater Revival, was notable because of some firsts.  What were they?
column4: It was the first time they recorded as a trio.
column5: It was the first time each member had at least one lead vocal on the album.
column6: It was the first time each recorded a bass track for a song on the album, as the bass player was battling depression.
column7: It was the first time they shared equal songwriting duties.
column8: It was the first album that featured "Creedence Clearwater Revival with John Fogerty" on the album cover.
column9: It was the first time the band had recorded an album on the road.

column1: What famous Jazz trumpeter played on the track "Meeting Across the River" on the 1975 Born to Run album by Bruce Springsteen?

What English drummer auditioned to join Paul McCartney's Wings in 1974 but lost the spot after being on the losing end of a coin toss?
The New Wave band Missing Persons were all alumni of what band?

David Bowie introduced the world to Major Tom in his 1969 song Space Oddity. He revisited this character again in a later song. Name it.
column4: The Man Who Sold The World

column1: How did Tony Iommi of Black Sabbath lose the tips of his middle and ring fingers on his right hand?
column5: Accident at a sheet metal factory
column6: He was electrocuted when he picked up a guitar with faulty wiring
column7: He didn't lose them, he was born that way
